pullRequest.title: Add Null Check to Command Validation
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #213.
I added the null check to commands with zero arguments as well.
I had made a ValidationTestable sub-interface that automated the null tests, but by the end of it I realized that the logic for generating the arglist permutations was complex enough that it basically warranted being tested itself, so I ended up scrapping it.
For a command with three parameters, the order of the tests is like this (x = null), and for four, it's the same pattern:
x x x
x x o
x o x
x o o
o x x
o x o
o o x

commit.message: Add null check for command validation

nodes.bodyText: This snippet looks like it's worth extracting to a utility method somewhere, rather than copy-pasting the implementation around.

For commands which expect 0 arguments, does it still make sense to make assertions about the contents of an empty array? They (should have) already validated that the array has length 0 at this point.

commit.message: Move null check to interface; remove check in 0-args
